reviews.review_msg: He is an outstanding educator. His course is not only comprehensive but also incredibly engaging. What truly sets him apart is his unwavering support and consideration for students. I'm truly thankful for the extra time he provided me to complete assignments. Professor Wister has made a significant positive impact on my learning experience!

He is a very nice and kind prof but the course material is just very dry and boring. Exams are ok, not bad but also not easy. The essay is long but he doesn't mark it very hard so it's nice. Just get ready to read.

The prof is a nice guy but the class is super dry as you pretty much only learn through his textbook. The paper isn't too bad despite the length, however the exams are brutal. They're super based on minor details, theories, or statistics from the textbook. The essay portions of the exams aren't too hard if you actually did the readings.
Takes the time to get to know his students! Gives great feedback and advice.

His multiple choice exams were tough- very specific researchers and statistics were expected to be recalled. He is a fair grader and helpful for papers and written work, but also an absolute expert in Gerontology so you better know what you're talking about. This course requires a lot of research and analytical reading.

SA420 is a solid choice for an online course. Dr. Wister makes his course very easy to navigate and to get a good grade in, with very little effort (just two exams and one paper). I am usually an A+ student & I found he grades a little low as I finished with an A- in the class, but overall he is a fair marker and exams don't contain any surprises.
Great professor, very informative. Exams are based on textbook material.

The exam focused more on statistics (for the MC) and theory (for long answer) rather than definitions. e.g. "women are more likely..." "xxx is the leading cause of..." type of questions. As a result a lot of material is skipped. The online modules and example exam questions had some concepts but were not tested, just study the textbook.

Andrew is knowledgeable and he cares. Online chats weren't mandatory but quite helpful for questions. The paper had clear criteria despite being long but that's expected when there is only the midterm/final (fair exams, just study, of course). The textbook was necessary - I used SFU reserves. I'd take another class with him, he's so friendly!
Very thorough and fair prof. Very Clear guidelines and expectations!

This was an online class for Fall 2012. I enjoyed the class and the professor was very knowledgeable about the underlying subjects in the class. Also he was very helpful and concise. Exams were fair and based off the textbook and units relatively easy to understand. I definitely recommend taking this class!
